data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: Its scientific name is "Oddium Wanderus." At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Vileplume
data.flavorText: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

abilities.name: Irritating Pollen
abilities.text: Each player can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

data.name: Bellossom
data.flavorText: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

attacks.name: Windmill
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flower Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Spinarak
data.flavorText: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Ariados
data.flavorText: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.

abilities.name: Poisonous Nest
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. Both Active Pokémon (except for Grass Pokémon) are now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Impound
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Combee
data.flavorText: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

data.name: Sceptile-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Unseen Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: M Sceptile-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jagged Saber
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal all damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

attacks.name: Intelligence Gathering
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Bee Revenge
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Bee Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Virizion
data.flavorText: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

attacks.name: Bail Out
attacks.text: Put 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Flareon
data.flavorText: It has a flame bag inside its body. After inhaling deeply, it blows out flames of nearly 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Flare Effect
abilities.text: Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a Fire Pokémon in addition to its existing types.

attacks.name: Heat Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

attacks.name: Burning Roar
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fire Energy cards, attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Combat Blaze
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Flame Screen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Volcarona
data.flavorText: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

attacks.name: Solar Birth
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Volcarona
data.flavorText: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Burning Scales
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Wind Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.name: Epic Splash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

attacks.name: Berserker Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Full Retaliation
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on each of your Benched Magikarp.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Relicanth
data.flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

attacks.name: Deep Sea Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Vaporeon
data.flavorText: It has evolved to be suitable for an aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.

abilities.name: Aqua Effect
abilities.text: Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a Water Pokémon in addition to its existing types.

data.name: Regice
data.flavorText: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Resistance Blizzard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

data.name: Ampharos-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Rod
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and attach as many Lightning Energy cards you find there as you like to this Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Sparkling Tail
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: M Ampharos-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Exavolt
attacks.text: You may do 50 more damage and leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed. If you do, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glaciate
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Icecalibur
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Jolteon
data.flavorText: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

abilities.name: Electric Effect
abilities.text: Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a Lightning Pokémon in addition to its existing types.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Electric Mischief
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: Farewell Letter
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it (this does not count as a Knock Out). If you do, draw a card.

data.name: Golett
data.flavorText: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Golurk
data.flavorText: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Future Spin
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

data.name: Claydol
data.flavorText: It is said that it originates from clay dolls made by an ancient civilization.

attacks.name: Rewind
attacks.text: Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Machamp-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steaming Mad
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Crazy Hammer
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

data.name: Hoopa-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Scoundrel Ring
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon-EX (except for Hoopa-EX), reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyperspace Fury
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Quagsire
data.flavorText: This carefree Pokémon has an easy-going nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.

attacks.name: Landslide
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Tyranitar-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Regirock
data.flavorText: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.

attacks.name: Unyielding Rock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Golurk
data.flavorText: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

attacks.name: Dig Out
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fighting Energy card, attach it to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: M Tyranitar-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Destroyer King
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

attacks.name: Bewitching Eyes
attacks.text: Choose a Supporter card from your opponent's discard pile and use it as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Furtive Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

attacks.name: Ink Spit
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Malamar
data.flavorText: It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

attacks.name: Entangling Control
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Trash Tentacle
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: It converses with others by magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Metagross
data.flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

abilities.name: Magnetic Warp
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Cannon
attacks.text: You may discard all Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Metagross
data.flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Machine Gun Stomp
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each card in your hand.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

data.name: Registeel
data.flavorText: Its body is said to be harder than any kind of metal. A study has revealed that its body is hollow.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Forbidden Iron Hammer
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Gardevoir
data.flavorText: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.

abilities.name: Bright Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

attacks.name: Cotton Bed
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.flavorText: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

attacks.name: Windy Mischief
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Giratina-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Renegade Pulse
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Mega Evolution Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaos Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

data.name: Goomy
data.flavorText: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.

abilities.name: Water Down
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, you may search your deck for Goomy and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

attacks.name: Act Tough
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Sliggoo
data.flavorText: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Goodra
data.flavorText: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that's the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.

attacks.name: Liquid Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Colorless in its Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shining Breath
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

data.name: Persian
data.flavorText: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

attacks.name: Data Check
attacks.text: Look through your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Porygon2
data.flavorText: With planetary development software installed, it became capable of working in space.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Lugia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aero Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Hurricane
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 70 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error…

attacks.name: Cyber Crush
attacks.text: Discard all Special Energy attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slowing Beam
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error…

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Digital Reboot
attacks.text: Devolve as many of your Benched Pokémon as many times as you like. Put each Evolution card removed this way into your hand.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Eco Arm
rules: Shuffle 3 Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ampharos Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Ampharos-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Recycler
rules: Shuffle 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ace Trainer
rules: You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent.
Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, draw 6 cards. Your opponent draws 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Faded Town
rules: At any time between turns, put 2 damage counters on each Mega Evolution Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Forest of Giant Plants
rules: Each player's Grass Pokémon can evolve during his or her first turn or the turn he or she plays those Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Hex Maniac
rules: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lucky Helmet
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Whenever the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), draw 2 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lysandre
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Level Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with 90 HP or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tyranitar Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Tyranitar-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sceptile Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Sceptile-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Paint Roller
rules: Discard any Stadium card in play. Then, draw a card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dangerous Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Darkness Pokémon. This card provides Darkness Energy only while this card is attached to a Darkness Pokémon.

Whenever the Darkness Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon-EX (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon-EX.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Darkness Pokémon, discard this card.)

data.name: Flash Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Lightning Pokémon. This card provides Lightning Energy only while this card is attached to a Lightning Pokémon.
The Lightning Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Lightning Pokémon, discard this card.)

data.name: Sceptile-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Unseen Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: M Sceptile-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jagged Saber
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal all damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glaciate
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Icecalibur
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Ampharos-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Rod
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and attach as many Lightning Energy cards you find there as you like to this Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Sparkling Tail
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: M Ampharos-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Exavolt
attacks.text: You may do 50 more damage and leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed. If you do, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Hoopa-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Scoundrel Ring
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon-EX (except for Hoopa-EX), reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyperspace Fury
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tyranitar-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Machamp-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steaming Mad
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Crazy Hammer
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

data.name: M Tyranitar-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Destroyer King
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Giratina-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Renegade Pulse
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Mega Evolution Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaos Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

data.name: Lugia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aero Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Hurricane
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 70 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

data.name: Primal Kyogre-EX
rules: Primal Reversion rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes Primal Kyogre-EX, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Max
ancientTrait.text: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes this Pokémon, heal all damage from it.

attacks.name: Tidal Storm
attacks.text: Move 2 Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: M Rayquaza-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Max
ancientTrait.text: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes this Pokémon, heal all damage from it.

attacks.name: Emerald Break
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Steven
rules: Search your deck for a Supporter card and a basic Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Primal Groudon-EX
rules: Primal Reversion rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes Primal Groudon-EX, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Max
ancientTrait.text: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes this Pokémon, heal all damage from it.

attacks.name: Gaia Volcano
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Trainers' Mail
rules: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Trainer card you find there (except Trainers' Mail) and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hex Maniac
rules: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).
